meanings.definition: A person who engages in a blockade.
meanings.sent1: The blockaders prevented the ships from entering the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The blockaders stood firm at the entrance, not allowing anyone to pass.
meanings.sent3: The blockaders decided to have a picnic at the blocked entrance for fun.
meanings.sent4: The blockaders were like a human wall, stopping all movement.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blockaders linking arms to form a barrier was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A group of people who block a passage or entrance.
meanings.sent1: A team of blockaders formed a line to stop the intruders.
meanings.sent2: The blockaders united to prevent unauthorized access to the area.
meanings.sent3: The blockaders accidentally blocked themselves in during the drill.
meanings.sent4: The blockaders resembled a living barricade, halting all progress.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the blockaders holding hands to create a barrier was striking.

meanings.definition: The act of blocking or obstructing.
meanings.sent1: The sudden blockaders of the road caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: The blockaders of the path made it difficult for others to pass through.
meanings.sent3: The blockaders of the doorway were actually just lost tourists.
meanings.sent4: The blockaders of progress were finally removed, allowing development to continue.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the blockaders on the flow of traffic was evident to all.
